comments.commentBody:
I could dissect the erroneous assumptions and incorrect assertions in your long post, but at this moment, here is the most pressing question;

If all of these contacts were innocuous, why did Trump and his entire team lie about them, and continue to lie about them to this day?

And I think we have the "missing tape" incident, mirroring the Nixon tape fiasco.  Remember, in his "first" "get to know you" conversation between Trump and Putin after the election, the tape recorder, which had been used for every other call between Trump and a foreign head of state, was "turned off."  Nice one, Trump.  No one gets to hear the "so nice to talk to you again" part of that conversation, not to mention the "don't worry about the sanctions" and "I think you'll really enjoy working with Tillerson" parts.  Couldn't be funnier, except for the selling out of our country part.
Only if republicans continue to cheat, gerrrymander, disenfranchise eligible voters...

We need to keep our eye on the ball, and dig out what the Russians have on Trump. The Republicans keep throwing distractions out in the hope that Democrats will focus on minor infractions--like Sessions. The big question is: what do the Russians have on Trump, and the next question that must be answered is--how much does Trump owe the Russians.

We cannot just let this go, and run around like dogs chasing their tails!
MSNBC Rachel Maddow. Other news outlets are also releasing details.

Here's the minimum that must be done with Sessions:

Torture the treasonous racist with depositions & subpoenas. Then convict, sanction, fire, terminate his political career.

Trump, or more likely Pence after Trump is dumped, will commute & pardon, but the defanging of Sessions is one step among many. The national imperative of neutering & dismantling the ongoing trumpocalypse. Delay, deny dissent!

Yes Ms. Pelosi, they impeached Clinton for far less, and yet you blew it by tabling the bills to impeach Dubbya. Don't make the same disastrous mistake again!

Repeal & replace the disastrous Trump gang, one by one.

But whatever you do with Beauregard, don't take your eye off Pruitt, his kind of crime against life on earth can't be undone.
augusta--Hear, hear!  Add Chuck Schumer, and dozens of other corporate Dems to the list

Sorry... but afraid not.  Little by little, the various "Russian shoes" will drop, and inexorably the pieces will lock into place.  When it finally happens, it's not going to be Democrats who are irrelevant.

In politics, "in Cleveland" will replace Mark Sanford's "hiking the Appalachian Trail" as the phrase to cover up something politicians should not be doing.  Sadly, only Sanford suffered in his affair scandal.  In the case of the Trump administration's dissembling, our democracy suffers.

“There's a fine line between genius and insanity...”
-Oscar Levant
I am not stretching anything. You can check for yourself on reliable mainstream media from whence my comments came. I do not pay attention to Breitbart or Faux Entertainment and the like.
What every happened to the good old days of Benghazi and Lock Her Up Emails?

Well those weren't treasonous high crimes.
In fact, as the complete lack of any charges being filed against HRC shows, they weren't crimes at all.
Just more mud slining by the koch's operatives in congress.

Where is Wikileaks when you need a release of restricted data! Trumps tax returns would keep Washington lawyers and accountants busy for years. God only knows how many dissertations would be written based on the shenanigans Trump has used to avoid paying taxes.

This is no big deal, the Democrats just learned how to spell Russian or at least Waters has. I am happy to see that CNN is losing in the polls and now is classified as a fake news station. Also glad to see the conservative democrats leaving the party. I guess nobody wants to be associated with extreme radical liberals. Keep up the good work, the republicans like your help

Do foreign diplomats regularly attend things like the Republican National Convention?  Although Kislyak was apparently a host to many Washingtonians in his guise as ambassador, going to Cleveland?!  Did he go to Philadelphia to attend the DNC?

Are we to believe that Sessions, as a lawyer, didn't understand the question Franken posed to him?! Lawyers are trained to listen closely to what is said.

Gail, it was unnessisary to drag Tiffany's name into this.
It was funny. Tiffany is an adult. She can handle it.
No she did not. That is provably a "fake conspiracy".  If she was elected and had these meetings you'd be crying bloody murder.

In a way, it's nice to see the Trump people and the GOP stumble in a net they have spun for themselves: Since nuance has been thrown out, it is difficult to defend a nuanced picture of the contacts with Russia. While they may be a little less innocent as the White House would like to have us believe, even if they were completely so, their base and the salivating media wouldn't believe them. Thus, the calculation might have been, better to deny any contact than try to defend them as innocent.
And let's be honest: Who among us would have believed that the contacts had been innocent? But as I wrote above: it was THEM who taught us to see only in two colours, black or white.

No; people like the Smirker of the House dismiss historians as liberal elites.

He falls askeep pondering drapery patterns for the Oval Office, you can be sure.

Perhaps it is time that someone, anyone, would inform President Trump that Russian representatives in this nation are monitored 24/7. If any of them make or receive a phone call, monitors know who was on the other end of that phone call. If a Russian representative has a meeting with anyone, monitors know about it.

Nobody has to do any wiretapping. Hasn’t anybody in the Trump administration or sphere of acquaintances watched a single modern spy or police movie or television show? Just because a cell phone will not work in a big concrete bunker does not mean that monitoring equipment cannot pick up every single word.

Contact with Russian representatives really is not in and of itself illegal or nefarious. But trying to cover up such contacts is just plain stupid in a place like Washington, D.C. Anybody going before Congress and either lying or trying to mislead without lying will have it explode in their face sooner or later. Even if a person actually told an untruth because they honestly forgot that person has to jump right in and start telling the truth and apologizing, not twiddle their thumbs waiting for their advisors to tell them which story to go with.

In his small circle of family and trusted employees, businessman Trump could keep control of information because for the most part nobody else really cared. Someone should tell him that now he is President of the United States of America, we do care. It’s time to stop tweeting and complaining.

Ever since the Soviet Union failed to deploy nuclear weapons in Cuba, there has been a lingering concern that something similar would again arise, but with an attached fear that it would do so when there was a smaller personality and a lesser intellect sitting behind the desk in the Oval Office...

All governments are kleptocracies in varying degrees. No one government wants to ruin the fun for all. If an international coalition were to invade N. Korea, or Sudan, or Brazil for that matter, and take control, end corruption, etc., what system would you have them put in place?

If you want chilling reading, studies suggest that even a "limited" nuclear exchange involving 100 or so Hiroshima-size weapons could have profound consequences for global climate due to the long-term effects of smoke in the atmosphere from the detonations, lowering temperatures and shortening growing seasons world wide for several years (http://www.nucleardarkness.org/warconsequences/catastrophicclimaticconse.... I guess, though, as global worming is a "fraud" according to our leadership we don't have to worry about anything those climate scientists say. . .

Since the North Korean nuclear weapons program could not be prevented, it must be contained.

Hostile actions ceased with an armistice signed by representatives of the US, the People’s Republic of China and North Korea in 1953. The recommended peace treaty between the two Koreas never materialized. Therefore, the burden remains upon the shoulders of the US and China to act in a concerted effort to reach a no-use agreement with the North Korean regime. The US must solicit China’s help in this endeavor. Ultimately, Koreans must find a solution to end this conflict.

This is the type information that is included in the CIA's daily presidential briefs (PDB), the ones that Trump has derided as unnecessary. And, the very real N. Korea threat to our national security is only one of several other threats we face, and which the President is supposed to protect us from.

Yet, he once again finds himself in Florida, wasting time on a photo op with Betsy DeVos on a meaningless school visit, then off to his golf club to schmooze with mega-wealthy opportunists who are looking for their own photo-ops.

In a related NYT article today, Trump is not even interested in nominating hundreds of executives and experts to some of the most critical positions in the federal government. He even suggested on Fox that the government doesn't even need these jobs filled - and this from someone who knows nothing of the work that needs to be done.

This irresponsible attitude portends a major train wreck for this country in the not too distant future. Bannon is about to achieve his "deconstruction of the administrative state," thanks to The Donald, his "imperfect vessel."
